title: 105_hr4093
content: The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" is cited as the short title. It establishes a standard relating to hospital lengths of stay for group health plans under the Public Health Service Act. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" requires group health plans to provide inpatient coverage for a medically appropriate period determined by a physician. It prohibits denying eligibility based on coverage requirements and penalizing providers for following the act. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" prohibits plans from avoiding coverage requirements, penalizing providers for following the act, incentivizing shorter inpatient stays, or requiring preauthorization for stay length determination. An appeals process and penalties for plan violations will be established by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Labor. The Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of Labor, will establish an appeals process and penalty for plans or issuers that violate the provisions of the "Hospital Stay Protection Act."
